restrictionInstructions.dataDistribution: DISTRIBUTION STATEMENT D: DISTRIBUTION AUTHORIZED TO DOD AND DOD CONTRACTORS ONLY. CRITICAL TECHNOLOGY, JULY 2012. OTHER REQUESTS SHALL BE REFERRED TO NAVSEA 07L. NO SECONDARY DISTRIBUTION AUTHORIZED WITHOUT WRITTEN APPROVAL OF THE APPLICABLE NAVSEA PROGRAM MANAGEMENT OFFICE.

exportRegistrationStmt.simplePara: WARNING: THIS DOCUMENT CONTAINS TECHNICAL DATA WHOSE EXPORT IS RESTRICTED BY THE ARMS EXPORT CONTROL ACT (TITLE 22, U.S.C., SEC. 2751, ET SEQ.) DISSEMINATE IN ACCORDANCE WITH PROVISIONS OF OPNAVINST 5510.161.

restrictionInstructions.dataDestruction: DESTRUCTION NOTICE: DESTROY BY ANY METHOD THAT WILL PREVENT DISCLOSURE OF CONTENTS OR RECONSTRUCTION OF THE DOCUMENT.

dmTitle.infoName: Default business rules exchange data module

commonInfoDescrPara.title: HAZARDOUS MATERIALS CONTROL STATEMENT
commonInfoDescrPara.para: For Forces Afloat, the Hazardous Material Users Guide (HMUG), S9086-WK-STM-020, NSTM Chapter 670 Volume II provides additional control measures, precautions, personal protective equipment (PPE), and spill controls for the hazardous material(s) identified in the Tools, Parts, Materials, Test, Equipment block. For other forces (expeditionary, shore based units, units based at a host nation facility), the OPNAVINST 5100.23 (series) provides guidance for Hazardous Material Control and Management (HMC&M) and directs the use of Safety Data Sheets (SDS) to determine additional control measures, precautions, personal protective equipment (PPE), and spill controls for the hazardous material(s) identified in the Tools, Parts, Materials, Test Equipment block. Maintenance personnel shall determine if additional PPE is necessary to accomplish the MRC and take appropriate action to obtain and wear such PPE to ensure the safety of maintenance personnel. Final disposition of all HAZMAT, both shipboard and ashore, shall be IAW local HAZMINCEN/CHRIMP guidance as required by OPNAVINST 5090.1 series Table 35-4. Report any deficiencies via PMS feedback report.

supportEquipDescr.name: [00466] Gage, depth, micrometer, 2-1/2" base, 12 rods, 0" to 12"

footnote.para: Numbers in brackets can be referenced to Standard PMS Materials Identification Guide (SPMIG) for identification.

supplyDescr.name: Anti-galling compound, A-A-59004 Hazardous Material User's Guide (HMUG) Group 11
[00648] Hoist, chain, 500-LB cap, nom. lg, hook to suspension
[01365] Technical manuals/drawings/forms, W/C to provide (NAVSEA S9515-AL-MMA-010)
[11922] Hazardous Material Users Guide (HMUG), S9086-WK-STM-020, NSTM 670 Vol II
[19009] S9086-KC-STM-010/CH-300; NAVAL SHIPS' TECHNICAL MANUAL, CHAPTER 300 ELECTRIC PLANT-GENERAL

footnote.para: Numbers in brackets can be referenced to Standard PMS Materials Identification Guide (SPMIG) for identification.
Numbers in brackets can be referenced to Standard PMS Materials Identification Guide (SPMIG) for identification.

caution.warningAndCautionPara: Forces afloat comply with Navy Safety and Occupational Health (SOH) Program Manual for Forces Afloat, OPNAVINST 5100.19 series; shore activities comply with SOH Program Manual, OPNAVINST 5100.23 series.
Oxidizer(s) must be operational or ship surface ventilating prior to inboard venting of recycle loop. Recycle gases are combustible.
Use care when removing line from fitting F32 as residual pressure may exist in line. Personal protective equipment including eye protection per OPNAVINST 5100-19C is required.

Equipment has multiple power sources. Consider all electrical leads / terminals to be energized until positively proven they are de-energized. Failure to comply may result in death or personnel injury.
To prevent personnel injury, Tag-Out procedures shall be in accordance with the Tag-out Users Manual (TUM), and/or local tag-out instruction.
Consider all electrical leads to be energized until positively proven they are de-energized.

Voltages dangerous to life may exist when performing Initial Voltage Verification (IVV) checks on electric or electronic equipment. IVV checks shall be performed in accordance with NSTM 300 section 300-2.5 (EXCEPTIONS TO ENERGIZED WORK REQUIREMENTS) and table 300-2-1b (IVV CHECKS) for Initial Voltage Verification (IVV).
Converter housing may be hot. Exercise caution to prevent burns.
Do not move converter housing cover without assistance. Cover weighs 200 pounds.

note.notePara: Accomplish this maintenance requirement when any of the following periodicities or situations occur.

proceduralStep.para: Every 5000 ±500 hours of BMP operation.

note.notePara: Observe upper/lower markings on replacement cartridges. Upper cartridge seal surface has holes around circumference.

proceduralStep.para: Perform preliminary actions to access converter housing as follows:
Verify GPU is energized and in OFF mode.
Align ILPE to operate with BMP secured in accordance with Technical Manual (TM) paragraph 2.4.8.2.
Lower level in ASU tank to less than 50 percent.
Shut manual valve MV-910A.

caution.warningAndCautionPara: Carefully monitor ASU tank level and pressure, making sure it stays below 1000 psig. A burst rupture disk in ASU will vent gas to BMP. Due to this risk, it is recommended that operator have adequate ventilation in AMR, have breathing mask available, and be prepared to have ASU contents dumped overboard.

proceduralStep.para: Remove access panel GPU-11.
Align catalyst for deactivation in accordance with TM paragraph 2.4.9.4.

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Oxidizer(s) must be operational or ship surface ventilating prior to inboard venting of recycle loop. Recycle gases are combustible.
Use care when removing line from fitting F32 as residual pressure may exist in line. Personal protective equipment including eye protection per OPNAVINST 5100-19C is required.

caution.warningAndCautionPara: Carefully monitor ASU tank level and pressure. With test cap installed on fitting F23, rupture disk overpressure protection is not available for ASU tank. ASU tank overpressure protection is provided by RCU.

proceduralStep.para: Put on goggles, then faceshield.
Disconnect fitting F23 from ASU and install test cap and plug (Cap and plug stored on face of ASU).
Remove faceshield, then goggles.
Verify power is removed from BMP.

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Equipment has multiple power sources. Consider all electrical leads / terminals to be energized until positively proven they are de-energized. Failure to comply may result in death or personnel injury.
To prevent personnel injury, Tag-Out procedures shall be in accordance with the Tag-out Users Manual (TUM), and/or local tag-out instruction.

proceduralStep.para: De-energize electrical power source(s) to ILPE unit and attach safety tag(s) in accordance with the TUM and/or local tag-out instruction.

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Consider all electrical leads to be energized until positively proven they are deenergized.

proceduralStep.para: Remove access panel GPU-3.
Remove access panels GPU-10 and GPU-11.
Remove access panel GPU-13.

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Voltages dangerous to life may exist when performing Initial Voltage Verification (IVV) checks on electric or electronic equipment. IVV checks shall be performed in accordance with NSTM 300 section 300-2.5 (EXCEPTIONS TO ENERGIZED WORK REQUIREMENTS) and table 300-2-1b (IVV CHECKS) for Initial Voltage Verification (IVV).

proceduralStep.para: Conduct Initial Voltage Verification checks in accordance with NSTM 300.
Disconnect three connectors from Cell Monitor Controller.
Remove four socket head cap screws that secure Cell Monitor Controller to frame and remove Cell Monitor Controller from GPU enclosure.
Remove as a unit the upper vertical frame member and horizontal frame member that Cell Monitor Controller was attached to.
Converter housing is now accessible.

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Converter housing may be hot. Exercise caution to prevent burns.

proceduralStep.para: Remove the converter housing top insulation blanket. Save for reuse.

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Do not move converter housing cover without assistance. Cover weighs 200 pounds.

proceduralStep.para: Remove converter housing cover as follows:

caution.warningAndCautionPara: Fastener removal must follow this procedure. Unloading jackbolts prematurely or out of sequence will cause remaining jackbolts to carry full load leading to jackbolt damage.

note.notePara: If converter cover has torque nuts installed, perform and then proceed to . Otherwise, proceed to .

proceduralStep.para: Loosen jackbolts 1/8 turn following circular pattern around each torque nut. Perform this on all torque nuts.
Repeat for all torque nuts, loosing jackbolts 1/4 turn. Repeat this step as required until all jackbolts are loose.
Remove nuts from converter housing cover.

note.notePara: When installing lifting eyebolt, coat thread bearing surfaces of lifting eyebolt (CP032-401) with Molykote P-37 or equivalent. Install lifting eyebolt into converter housing cover and torque 9.5 to 11.5 ft-lbs.

proceduralStep.para: Ensure lock nut is threaded all the way onto converter housing cover lifting eyebolt.
Install lifting arm to GPU frame.

note.notePara: Frame mounting holes are not marked but will be readily identified when access panels are removed.

proceduralStep.para: Install lifting eyebolt and lock nut into converter housing cover. Tighten eyebolt into cover until lock nut makes contact. Torque lock nut to between 9.5 to 11.5 ft-lbs.
Attach one end of a lifting arm to lifting ring and other to converter housing cover lifting eyebolt.
Carefully remove converter housing cover, keeping cover level to prevent binding of bolts. Set cover on deck out of way.
Remove metallic compression gasket from converter housing and discard.
Remove cartridge shims, clean, visually inspect and save for reuse.
Open cartridge shipping container and remove replacement cartridges.
Retain all packing material from shipping container.

Remove used upper cartridge and place into empty upper cartridge shipping container, unless cartridge is noticeably hot. If hot, set cartridge aside and allow it time to cool. It is unusual, but it may take up to 24 hours to cool.

ove used lower cartridge and place into empty lower cartridge shipping container, unless cartridge is noticeably hot. If hot, set cartridge aside and allow it time to cool. It is unusual, but it may take up to 24 hours to cool.
Seal container and securely tag as "Used Cartridges".
Visually inspect bolts for damage. Refer to Converter housing flange boltChange = Remove and install a new item if bolt(s) require replacement.
Completely clean interior of converter housing using lint free cloth dampened with potable water.
Install lower cartridge as follows:
Remove shipping covers and wrappings.
Clean lower cartridge using lint free cloth dampened with potable water.
Inspect lower cartridge for physical damage.
Install lower cartridge into the converter housing.
Install upper cartridge as follows:
Remove shipping covers and wrappings.
Clean upper cartridge using lint free cloth dampened with potable water.
Inspect upper cartridge for physical damage.
Install upper cartridge into converter housing.
Shim cartridges as follows:
Carefully clean converter housing top.
Record dimension (A) marked on converter housing cover near lifting eyebolt in .
Place straight edge across converter housing top opening.

Using 18 inch metal ruler and feeler gauges or depth micrometer, measure from top of converter housing to outer shim surface of upper cartridge at three sites, 120 degrees apart. Record measurements after subtracting depth of straight edge. Label these measurements a, b, and c and record in .
Determine average depth measurement (D) from three measurements a, b, and c and record that calculation in .
Add average depth measurement (D) to dimension (A). This is total minimum shim height (SH) in inches. Record that calculation in .
Measure shim(s) with micrometer and assemble necessary shim(s) in order to obtain actual shim height of between SH and SH +0.016 in.
Place assembled shim(s) on top of upper cartridge.

note.notePara: An alternate part number for the compression gasket is P/N 00887370, CAGE 58156.

proceduralStep.para: Install metallic compression gasket in converter housing as follows:
Ensure top surface of converter housing is clean.
Inspect new metallic compression gasket for damage.
Install new metallic gasket onto converter housing top.

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Do not move converter housing cover without assistance. Cover weighs 200 pounds.

proceduralStep.para: Install converter housing cover as follows:
Clean sealing surface of cover.

caution.warningAndCautionPara: Converter housing cover must be set with alignment pin.

proceduralStep.para: Attach lifting device hook to converter housing cover and carefully set cover in place using alignment pin.
Remove lifting device hook from converter housing cover eyebolt.
Remove lifting device and lifting ring from ILPE frame.
Remove lifting eyebolt from converter housing cover.
Light coat threads of converter housing bolts with MOLYKOTE P-37 lubricant.

note.notePara: If converter cover had torque nuts removed in and ), then perform , , , , , and . Otherwise, proceed to .

proceduralStep.para: Ensure jackbolts are flush or recessed into torque nut.
Slide washer over T-Bolt until flush with cover.
Spin torque nut onto T-Bolt thread, until it seats against washer.
Tighten 4 jackbolts as close to 90 degrees apart as possible on all 14 T-Bolts. Torque jackbolts to 45 in-lb at this time.
When all 14 T-Bolts have been tightened, repeat on the same jackbolts and torque to 90 in-lb.

Torque all 10 jackbolts on each torque nut to 90 in-lb in circular pattern. Torque each jackbolt once then move to next T-Bolt/torque nut. T-Bolt/torque nuts should be tightened in crossing pattern. This process may require 2-4 passes around converter cover until all jackbolts are at final torque.

note.notePara: If replacement of housing nuts is/are required, use SPMIG [17173], or alternate part number for the housing cover nuts P/N: H1218-06159, CAGE 96906.

proceduralStep.para: Install housing cover nuts. Torque to between 290 to 300 ft-lbs in 100 ft-lb increments, per JFMM, in diametrically opposite pattern.
Position insulation blanket on top of converter housing cover.
Align Active Storage Unit to BMP as follows:
Open manual valve MV-910A.
Carefully remove test cap (store on ASU face) from bulkhead fitting F23 and install line leading to BMP.
Reassemble Converter Housing Acess as follows:
Install as unit: upper vertical frame member and horizontal frame member that Cell Monitor Controller was attached to. Torque frame member socket head cap screws 60 to 70 ft-lbs.
Install four socket head cap screws that secure Cell Monitor Controller to frame. Torque Cell Monitor socket head cap screws 96 to 112 in-lbs in a crossing pattern.
Install three connectors from Cell Monitor Controller.
Install access panels GPU-3, GPU-10, GPU-11, and GPU-13.
Remove safety tag(s) from electrical power source(s) to ILPE unit in accordance with the TUM and/or local tag-out instruction, then re-energize circuits.
Calibrate P-1124G, P-1426G, P-1334B, P-1342B, DPT-1617G, DPT-1335B, and DPT-1336B in accordance with MRC R-13 (H9ZP).
Accomplish MRC R-6 (9QPA).
Perform steps to return ILPE to operational condition in accordance with NAVSEA S9515-AL-MMA-010.
Align BMP for and perform drop test in accordance with MRC U-7 (E5BG).
